# Draft:The Wine Travel Awards

The Wine Travel Awards (WTA) is an international wine tourism initiative established by Communication Media Group Drinks+. Drawing on more than 35 years of industry expertise, the WTA was created to promote excellence and foster innovation in global wine tourism.
The WTA is structured as more than a traditional award or rating system. Its primary aim is to foster a global community of wine professionals, brands, and enthusiasts. Nominees benefit from a 1.5-year integrated marketing campaign through Drinks+ media channels and partner events, offering long-term visibility and networking opportunities. The initiative is designed to highlight the achievements of all participants, regardless of final placement, emphasizing collaboration and recognition across the wine and tourism sectors.
Structure and Global Reach
As of 2025, the WTA network includes participants from over 44 countries, ranging from internationally renowned producers such as Château Smith Haut Lafitte (France) and Cloudy Bay (New Zealand) to small artisanal wineries.
The awards comprise six categories:
•	Visiting Card of the Country
•	Enogastronomic Events
•	Education in Enotourism
•	Wine and Food Influencer
•	Wine Ambassador
•	Wine Guide
The first three categories recognize achievements in tourism and business, while the latter three focus on influential individuals contributing to wine culture and communication. In 2023, the WTA was selected for the Bernard Magrez Start-Up Win Incubator, highlighting its potential for further innovation and growth.
Judging and Selection Process
The WTA employs a two-stage selection process: public voting takes place in March, followed by evaluation by an international professional jury in April. Past jury members have included prominent industry figures such as Robert Joseph, Felicity Carter, Dr. Gergely Szolnoki, Nina Basset, Per Karlsson, Fiona Morrison MW, Tim Hanni MW, Richard Bampfield MW, and others. The process annually results in 16 category winners, alongside Judges’ Choice recognitions and Grand Prix awards, contributing to increased visibility for wine tourism operators worldwide.
